channel.title: Pandemonium [Updates]
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/35jfipz.png[/img][/center]
Pandemonium is a RuneScape 317 emulator I've been writing for about a week now. I plan to develop this to the point of being able to implement content. Pandemonium is based off of Fox which I posted in the download section a few weeks ago. The same principals apply here, it will be a light weight framework that makes use of the NIO reactor pattern. I'll try to update this thread whenever I make a step in the development. The framework is multi-threaded and is based around the idea of keeping it simple and easy to follow without sacrificing performance in the process. I'd like someone to be able to pick up this server and within twenty minutes understand how the internals work without running through 50 polymorphic classes.
Content:
[ul][li]Multi-Threaded Backing[/li] [li]Entity Based[/li] [li]Console[/li] [li]Player Updating[/li] [li]Player Movement[/li] [li]Packet Obfuscation & Deobfuscation[/li] [li]Concurrent Approach[/li] [li]Selector Reactor Pattern Implementation[/li][/ul]
When writing in an IDE i've often found it a little hard to actually keep track of whats being debugged and printed since it is usually crammed in a small console in the bottom corner. For this purpose I decided to write my own basic one.
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/wio7xd.png[/img]
In my opinion this gives a better view when debugging code or just trying to keep track of any run-time attributes.
I've recently made it to the point of global login and player updating, by this I mean that everyone in your region will see you when your added into the world and can interact with you as such. The release I posted lacked this feature.
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/snezvo.png[/img]
Global player movement has been completed. Both walking and running are supported.
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/20fao3m.png[/img]
Support for global chat has been added alongside a few outgoing packets.
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2vai3hz.png[/img]
Support for context menus has been added.
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/294sbcg.png[/img]
Support for side-bar interaces.
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/i254qv.png[/img]
Appearance Modification - opening, closing, and buttons on the interface have been handled.
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/1443ew8.png[/img]
Loaded the original 317 cache.
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2i0ssyb.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2hx1542.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2u91mbb.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/ftpyr4.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/AHehjQq.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2nlz4ft.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2cnjtbp.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/lol_zpsde087364.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/t8x8c3.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/28hiyon.png[/img]
Im currently stress testing the server but seem to disconnect around 500 players without an error or exception to be seen. Once this is fixed and I can verify that this server will hold over 1500 bots (packet spamming) on my computer ill return to content.
I'm still very new to the protocol so most of it is either reading from a re-factored client or referencing the wiki so i'm moving at a slow pace right now. Once most of the networking, packet obfuscation, and deobfuscation is done I should be able to move at a much faster pace.
Also if anyone is interested in giving me any criticism on the source code and can prove you know what you're doing I'll send you a download link.

item.title: Pandemonium [Updates]
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

Banking has been completed along with multiple fixes to inventory and equipment. These Include: Withdrawing a stackable item with a full inventory, withdrawing a stackable item with one remaining space, switching items with a full inventory, and holding over 28 stackable items alongside your other items. The item system on Pandemonium uses Grahams item container for those who are curious.

am5qa.png774×530

Read full topic

item.title: Pandemonium [Updates]
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:60, topic:531516”][quote author=Vix link=topic=650304.msg4369093#msg4369093 date=1380242969]
P.S You haven’t seen the source code and know nothing about the design besides the fact that it uses XML.
[/quote]
I believe he is determining the design via the server you released previously.

Its parsed before hand, not on the spot which eliminates the issue of it being slow to read.

There goes my part of saying “Yuck” and now’s my turn to say, “Good job.”

So, good job. :)[/quote]

If you mean Fox, that was posted a little over a month ago. A lot can and did change in that time period. Pandemonium is built much more like an actual asynchronous game server now rather than a login server which only handled the mere basics of the protocol. I don’t understand why XML has been given such a bad rap lately, and using it is no reason to think there is a poor design backing it up. Apollo was built around it and you all seem to consider that server very well written. Every programmer has his/her preference when it comes to something like parsing data. There is no right answer. Its an open selection to whatever the programmer can make use of the easiest.

@Ryley Never showed you anything pertaining to this source mate, only bounced ideas off you. And its no secret? Go back to writing your mini-games big boy

Read full topic

item.title: Pandemonium [Updates]
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Yuck.

Its parsed before hand, not on the spot which eliminates the issue of it being slow to read. Its also a much more organized way of in-sourcing and manipulating data than the traditional methods which most servers use. I know JSONs all the rage right now but when it comes to reading data on launch its personal preference alone.

P.S You haven’t seen the source code and know nothing about the design besides the fact that it uses XML.

Read full topic
